thread.title: McCarthy expresses regret for Benghazi comments
thread.title_full: McCarthy expresses regret for Benghazi comments - US News

author: USNews
title: McCarthy expresses regret for Benghazi comments
text:
House majority leader McCarthy expresses 'regret' for comments on Benghazi committee Associated Press Oct. 2, 2015 | 10:27 a.m. EDT + More WASHINGTON (AP) â€” House Majority Leader Kevin McCarthy says he regrets suggesting the House special committee on Benghazi has political goals.
McCarthy says he never intended to make that suggestion. He says the purpose of the committee is to find out the truth, and that it has nothing to do with politics.
McCarthy spoke in an interview on Fox News Channel. He aims to quell controversy after boasting earlier this week that the Benghazi committee was responsible for Hillary Rodham Clinton's dropping poll numbers.
Democrats pounced on McCarthy's initial comments, saying they proved that the committee is on a witch hunt against the Democrats' leading presidential candidate.
Even some Republicans criticized McCarthy, who is campaigning to become speaker of the House following the resignation of John Boehner (BAY'-nuhr).
